title: Pearl Bank given green light by Bank of Uganda
description:
Bank of Uganda Grants Operating License to Pearl Bank

Kampala, Uganda | THE INDEPENDENT | The Bank of Uganda (BoU) has issued an operating license to Pearl Bank Uganda Limited, which formerly operated as PostBank Uganda, paving the way for the institution to commence business under its new name and...

title: Uganda’s minerals sector still struggles to tell the full story
description:
Fourth EITI report reveals companies still dodge key disclosures as beneficial ownership data remains thin and contract transparency has barely moved

title: ‘Akii Bua Stadium to accelerate Lango’s economic growth’
description:
Kampala, Uganda | THE INDEPENDENT | Officials say the Akii Bua Stadium, currently under construction in Lira City, is more than just an architectural piece but embodies the National Resistance Movement’s (NRM) commitment to regional equity and development.

The stadium is fast becoming a flagship of...

title: Uganda looks to generate $20bn in processed agriculture exports
description:
Uganda plans to increase the value of its processed agricultural exports to $20 billion annually by the year 2040, an ambitious target that is five times higher than the current level.

The Minister of State for Planning, Amos Lugoloobi said the government has launched the Economic and Commercial Di...

title: VP Alupo calls on government institutions to work together to achieve vision 2040
description: The Vice President of Uganda, Rtd Maj. Jessica Alupo has urged government institutions to work together to help the central government achieve Vision 2040. Alupo says it is the responsibility of all central government institutions to operate in alignment toward this goal, which aims not only to incr...

title: Museveni calls youth unemployment a ‘good challenge,’ urges relevant education
description: President Yoweri Museveni has described youth unemployment in the country as a “good challenge,” noting that a solution has been discovered. Museveni, whose message at the 21st graduation ceremony of Gulu University was delivered by Prime Minister Robinah Nabbanja, says the solution lies in teaching...

title: New report links rising youth crime to poverty, unemployment in Uganda
description: A new report warns of a rising risk of violent extremism, particularly among unemployed urban youth in Uganda. The Youth Crime Report reveals increasing involvement of young people in a wide range of crimes. Covering the period between 2017 and 2024, the study—released by the Uganda Youth Developmen...
